intro: Dryandra columnaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a striking member of the Proteaceae family native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces vibrant, pink to red flowers in cylindrical inflorescences, which are typical of the genus Dryandra. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a valued species in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
